abstract.p: Correction on Jan 10 article about faculty opposition to proposal to make Southern Methodist University site of Pres Bush's presidential library concerns venue in which university vice pres Brad Cheves was interviewed

block.p: An article on Wednesday about faculty opposition to a proposal to make Southern Methodist University the site of President Bush's presidential library misstated the venue in which Brad Cheves, the university's vice president for development and external affairs, commented on the debate. He was interviewed after leaving a campus meeting, but not the faculty meeting where objections were raised.
